title: Tropical Cyclone Koji makes landfall in North Queensland as category 1 | ABC NEWS
description: Tropical Cyclone Koji has made landfall in North Queensland as a category 1 system. The storm crossed the coast between Ayr and Bowen, packing powerful winds and heavy rain.  Queensland Premier David Crisafulli says both authorities and residents have taken the cyclone threat seriously and are well-prepared for its impact. title: Cyclone Koji weakens to tropical low, flood warnings remain | ABC NEWS
description: Tropical Cyclone Koji has weakened to a tropical low after making landfall on Queensland's north coast. The system crossed between Ayr and Bowen, bringing heavy rain and strong winds as it tracks west through the region. Flood warnings remain in place for parts of the state with forecast heavy rainfall. title: Victoria bushfires leave trail of destruction as government announces relief | ABC NEWS
description: At least 300 structures have been destroyed as bushfires burnt through 350,000 hectares of land in Victoria.  Thousands of firefighters and dozens of helicopters have been deployed to combat emergency-level blazes at 10 firegrounds across the state.  Authorities say it will take days to fully assess the extent of damage from the blazes. Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan have announced a $19.5 million relief package for impacted residents. title: Afghan earthquake survivors brace for winter cold as aid falls short | ABC NEWS
description: After a powerful earthquake tore through Afghanistan's eastern mountains, survivors are now facing another deadly threat — a bitterly cold winter. Aid agencies say support for thousands of people sleeping rough is falling well short of what's needed. South Asia Correspondent Meghna Bali, camera operator Haidarr Jones, and producer Som Patidar travelled deep into Kunar Province to speak with earthquake survivors. title: Talc Alf's carved artworks attract tourists travelling the SA outback | ABC NEWS
description: Amid the light brown sand and sparse scrub of outback South Australia, up springs Talc Alf's workshop, crafted using salvaged materials and emblazoned with the words "Reppublic [sic] University of Common Sense". His material of choice? The soft, powdery talc that he has been sourcing around Australia since a stint working with geologists in Bunbury — it is what has given him the nickname he has come to be known by both near and afar. title: Dozens of buildings destroyed in Harcourt fires in central Victoria | ABC NEWS
description: It's believe 47 homes and three businesses have been lost in the fire near Ravenswood South so far.  The fire ground is now about 80 per cent contained.  ABC reporter Oliver Gordon was on the ground in Harcourt earlier today, and saw the damage firsthand. title: Thousands march in Minneapolis after shooting of Renee Good | ABC NEWS
description: Tens of thousands have marched through the streets of Minneapolis to protest after the fatal shooting of US citizen Renee Good by an immigration agent. Protests have also erupted across the country, with demonstrators calling for accountability and the withdrawal of federal agents from their cities. But, the Trump administration has responded by deploying more federal officers. title: Residents share footage of Cyclone Koji after it makes landfall in north Qld | ABC NEWS
description: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji has made landfall in north Queensland as a tropical low, bringing heavy rain and damaging winds of up to 113 kilometres per hour.  The Bureau of Meteorology says up to 327mm of rain has been recorded in some areas in just six hours, causing flash flooding in some areas. title: Iran signals intensifying crackdown on anti-government protesters | ABC NEWS
description: Protesters in Iran are pushing against the Islamic republic's rulers and have taken to the streets of the capital with anti-government chants.    Rights groups fear that authorities are intensifying a deadly crackdown under the cover of an internet blackout that has lasted 48 hours. title: Floodwaters from Queensland turn remote NSW desert into an oasis | ABC NEWS
description: A remote desert in NSW has been transformed into a flourishing oasis after floodwaters from the 2024 Queensland floods migrated south. Ecologists say the inundation of Narriearra Caryapundy Swamp, an ephemeral wetland that only fills every 10 to 20 years, has created a healthy ecosystem among the most incredible wetlands in Australia. title: Human remains discovered in bushfire-ravaged central Victoria | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 Victoria has confirmed its first fatality in the state's bushfire emergency, with police discovering human remains east of the town of Seymour. 00:54 Residents in central Victoria have returned to survey the damage to homes and property, as the state and federal governments unveil a $19.5 million support package. 03:35 Olivia Sanders reports from the Otway Ranges where some fires are still burning dangerously, despite favourable weather conditions and backburning. 05:03 Ashlee Aldridge reports from Wodonga on the NSW border where some residents are sheltering at the local relief centre for the second night in a row. 07:05 Residents of the central Victorian town of Harcourt are only now returning home to witness the devastation since fires ripped through the area on Friday. title: CFA volunteer who lost his home recounts 26hr fight against Longwood bushfire | ABC NEWS
description: Volunteer firefighter Michael Harper lost his Alexandra home while defending other homes in central Victoria against catastrophic bushfires. Michael recounts an intense 26 hour fight against extreme conditions, during which his strike team of four helped save his own town from the flames. title: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji crosses coast bringing intense rainfall | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 Ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji has crossed the north Queensland coast near the town of Ayr, bringing heavy rain and breaking some boats from their moorings. 00:32 The flood impacts of Koji are far worse than its category 1 crossing strength, with residents affected all across the region. 02:54 Johanna Marie reports from Mackay where heavy rainfall has affected residents further inland. 04:03 Jacqui McLaren takes a look at the charts to see what we can expect next from ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji.
